intro: Aplotaxis multicaulis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a shrub with erect, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, blooming in spring and summer. Aplotaxis multicaulis is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping.
